glossdef.p: The Fast Response Cache Accelerator (FRCA) is a feature of the HTTP Server that improves performance by caching static files such as text and images. It serves cached files from the TCP/IP layer, bypassing the HTTP Server for faster response times. FRCA operates only when the connection is not secure (non-SSL) and does not cache dynamic content or protected pages.
glossdef.text: FRCA automatically caches eligible files without requiring explicit listing, but sensitive files should be excluded using the FRCANoCachin directive to ensure proper authentication.
